column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=VI
#Text=As we all went up it occurred to me that there ought to be a man at the helm .

#Text=I raised my voice not much above a whisper , and , noiselessly , an uncomplaining spirit in a fever-wasted body appeared in the light aft , the head with hollow eyes illuminated against the blackness which had swallowed up our world -- and the universe .
#Text=The bared forearm extended over the upper spokes seemed to shine with a light of its own .
#Text=I murmured to that luminous appearance :
#Text=“ Keep the helm right amidships . ”
#Text=It answered in a tone of patient suffering :
#Text=“ Right amidships , sir . ”
#Text=Then I descended to the quarter-deck .
#Text=It was impossible to tell whence the blow would come .
#Text=To look round the ship was to look into a bottomless , black pit .
#Text=The eye lost itself in inconceivable depths .
#Text=I wanted to ascertain whether the ropes had been picked up off the deck .
#Text=One could only do that by feeling with one ’s feet .
#Text=In my cautious progress I came against a man in whom I recognized Ransome .
#Text=He possessed an unimpaired physical solidity which was manifest to me at the contact .
#Text=He was leaning against the quarter-deck capstan and kept silent .
#Text=It was like a revelation .
#Text=He was the collapsed figure sobbing for breath I had noticed before we went on the poop .
#Text=“ You have been helping with the mainsail ! ” I exclaimed in a low tone .
#Text=“ Yes , sir , ” sounded his quiet voice .
#Text=“ Man !
#Text=What were you thinking of ? You must n’t do that sort of thing . ”
#Text=After a pause he assented :
#Text=“ I suppose I must n’t . ”
#Text=Then after another short silence he added :
#Text=“ I am all right now , ” quickly , between the tell-tale gasps .
#Text=I could neither hear nor see anybody else ; but when I spoke up , answering sad murmurs filled the quarter-deck , and its shadows seemed to shift here and there .
#Text=I ordered all the halyards laid down on deck clear for running .
#Text=“ I ’ll see to that , sir , ” volunteered Ransome in his natural , pleasant tone , which comforted one and aroused one ’s compassion , too , somehow .
#Text=That man ought to have been in his bed , resting , and my plain duty was to send him there .
#Text=But perhaps he would not have obeyed me ; I had not the strength of mind to try .
#Text=All I said was :
#Text=“ Go about it quietly , Ransome . ”
#Text=Returning on the poop I approached Gambril .
#Text=His face , set with hollow shadows in the light , looked awful , finally silenced .
#Text=I asked him how he felt , but hardly expected an answer .
#Text=Therefore , I was astonished at his comparative loquacity .
#Text=“ Them shakes leaves me as weak as a kitten , sir , ” he said , preserving finely that air of unconsciousness as to anything but his business a helmsman should never lose .
#Text=“ And before I can pick up my strength that there hot fit comes along and knocks me over again . ”
#Text=He sighed .
#Text=There was no reproach in his tone , but the bare words were enough to give me a horrible pang of self-reproach .
#Text=It held me dumb for a time .
#Text=When the tormenting sensation had passed off I asked :
#Text=“ Do you feel strong enough to prevent the rudder taking charge if she gets sternway on her ? It would n’t do to get something smashed about the steering-gear now .
#Text=We ’ve enough difficulties to cope with as it is . ”
#Text=He answered with just a shade of weariness that he was strong enough to hang on .
#Text=He could promise me that she should n’t take the wheel out of his hands .
#Text=More he could n’t say .
#Text=At that moment Ransome appeared quite close to me , stepping out of the darkness into visibility suddenly , as if just created with his composed face and pleasant voice .
#Text=Every rope on deck , he said , was laid down clear for running , as far as one could make certain by feeling .
#Text=It was impossible to see anything .
#Text=Frenchy had stationed himself forward .
#Text=He said he had a jump or two left in him yet .
#Text=Here a faint smile altered for an instant the clear , firm design of Ransome ’s lips .
#Text=With his serious clear , gray eyes , his serene temperament -- he was a priceless man altogether .
#Text=Soul as firm as the muscles of his body .
#Text=He was the only man on board ( except me , but I had to preserve my liberty of movement ) who had a sufficiency of muscular strength to trust to .
#Text=For a moment I thought I had better ask him to take the wheel .
#Text=But the dreadful knowledge of the enemy he had to carry about him made me hesitate .
#Text=In my ignorance of physiology it occurred to me that he might die suddenly , from excitement , at a critical moment .
#Text=While this gruesome fear restrained the ready words on the tip of my tongue , Ransome stepped back two paces and vanished from my sight .
#Text=At once an uneasiness possessed me , as if some support had been withdrawn .
#Text=I moved forward , too , outside the circle of light , into the darkness that stood in front of me like a wall .
#Text=In one stride I penetrated it .
#Text=Such must have been the darkness before creation .
#Text=It had closed behind me .
#Text=I knew I was invisible to the man at the helm .
#Text=Neither could I see anything .
#Text=He was alone , I was alone , every man was alone where he stood .
#Text=And every form was gone too , spar , sail , fittings , rails ; everything was blotted out in the dreadful smoothness of that absolute night .
